html:
9.22.22  4:04 am   Can you outstupid someone?

      sure

9.22.22  12:20 am   so, after like 5 years of doing  absolutely nothing, i might finally be brave enough to start creating music. but how do i know what kind of music i want to create? i have no clear vision or goal in my mind. i have feelings i would like to express, but i don't know how my feelings "sound" yet. i have a digital piano and a mixing software and i'm still going nowhere... HOW DO I START MOVING

      here's a trick that might get you through this..... try caring about what kind of words you say and when. in otherwords, try writing the material before you set foot in the production environment. after all, this is what's done with almost all movies, tv shows, and probably most songs also. all of my songs are written before they are produced. it's similar to making the blueprint of a house before building the house. starting in the production environment with no song written reminds me of showing up to a house construction site with no blueprint for the house. it took a couple of years for this realization to occur to me, but i was much much happier when it did

9.21.22  12:22 pm   How did you get so good at playing on the keyboard really fast? Was it just practice and experience, or are there playing exercises you did?

      of all the things you can do or try on the keyboard, i've noticed that there is 1 thing that gives you a 10x speed and accuracy boost. and it's this: actually playing what you mean, in that moment. There are many ways this can or can't occur, depending on the situation, whether you are improvising or not improvising, but, again, the 1 defining thing that gives you the biggest speed, accuracy, quality, and everything boost is whether or not you happen to mean what you're saying in that moment. also the same is true with acting

9.21.22  1:24 am   What do you consider to be some examples of a music theory breaking or being evaded by music?

      all the time. every moment of every piece of music. notes change. Let's say we're on a note, minding our own business..... music theory at this moment is telling us this is the 'correct note'. But then we switch notes, so why the heck would we switch away from the right note? Ok, well, maybe right now you're thinking, "but music theory is not just 1 right note, it's a series of instructions for what is the right series of notes." in that case i would have to point out that no such instructions exist

9.20.22  10:12 pm   I just found a fucked up thing about music, like Lovecraftian horror levels of fucked up. The circle of fifths going up by sharps, right? Each key's tonic becomes the new sharp of the key two fifths further along in the circle. If you're in the key of B, go back two keys to A, then A♯ is the last sharp of B. So what if the circle didn't end? What if I continued the circle? What if I wrote G♯? F double sharp, Bill. A black and unspeakable curse writ only by the dark lords of music, long before the Universe began. If I treasured dear life, I should have ventured no further. But I was already too far gone. One by one, I sharpened the sharps in the key signature. Every single one. And when I entered the key of G double sharp- It never stops. It's sharps forever, all the way into musical infinity. I can never return to sanity.

     sure you can. you can just go back the other way

     I stared into the abyss, and it stared back into me.

     i understand. the night sky seems like that

     I'm scared, Bill. What ever will I do?

      you can just stay on earth. if there's too many sharps you can just take away 7 (or add 7 flats, and the flats and sharps cancel out). If you are writing, you'll have to re-write but just move everything up or down one line/space

9.20.22  9:37 pm   Do you think everyone who has a dream or special interest should try to pursue it, even if it's hard?

9.20.22  8:14 pm   i feel like i can come up with a bunch of melodies and i would like to compose those ideas but whenever i have a melody or chords in my head i dont know the names of them or which notes on the piano to actually play or even how to get it on sheet music fast enough before i forget the melody i thought of. i want to make songs but i feel too much of a disconnect between my ideas and my knowledge on what notes they actually are

      all these doorways start to open, the more time you spend at the instrument. doing what at the instrument, you ask? everything. spend a whole afternoon living your life at the instrument. communicate daily transactions, using your instrument

9.20.22  7:44 pm   "Where I was, I just found out I wasn't"
Damn what an enlightenment-inducing line. What was your inspiration, or have you said this (or conveyed this sentiment) before outside the context of the song?

     it wrote itself. was simply shopping for an ending line, and in about .5 seconds that one came to mind. i would have rejected it for being too standard (take the first line of the song and sort of 'deflate' it) but i found about 3 meanings within this one so it seemed worth it. also that was before i did like 3 re-writes of the last 60 seconds, but i kept that final line each time. so that was originally written with a different section before it, but out of all those choices it works the best after what it is now

9.20.22  6:45 pm   there is so much to do on this earth which is fucking magnificent and gorgeous but also soul crushing!????? it makes me do nothing instead.     any advice :( i am superwhelmed 

      make a nice list of things you could do. consider it an infinite list. add to it every day. the fun part of an infinite list is you never run out of things to put on the list
